dublinCore.dc:title: 117 HR 9458 IH: To provide temporary authority to the Secretary of Defense to appoint retired members of the Armed Forces to military health system positions, and for other purposes.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Kilmer introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Oversight and Reform

form.official-title: To provide temporary authority to the Secretary of Defense to appoint retired members of the Armed Forces to military health system positions, and for other purposes.

section.header: Temporary authority to appoint retired members of the Armed Forces to Military Health System positions
section.text: Section 1108 of the William M. (Mac) Thornberry National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2021 (Public Law 116–283) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (a), by striking subsection (b) and inserting subsection (b) or (c);
in the heading for subsection (b), by striking Positions and inserting Defense industrial base facility positions;
by redesignating subsections (c), (d), and (e) as subsections (d), (e), and (f), respectively;
by inserting after subsection (b) the following:

subsection.text: The positions in the Department described in this subsection are medical or health profession positions in the civil service within the military health system.

paragraph.text: by amending subsection (f) (as redesignated by paragraph (3) of this section) to read as follows:
the term civil service has the meaning given that term in section 2101 of title 5, United States Code;
the term medical or health profession positions means any position listed under any of paragraphs (1), (2), or (3) of section 7401 of title 38, United States Code; and
the terms member and Secretary concerned have the meaning given those terms in section 101 of title 37, United States Code.
